meanings.definition: To settle to the bottom of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sand is slowly sedimenting in the water.
meanings.sent2: The mud is sedimenting at the bottom of the pond.
meanings.sent3: The tiny pebbles are having a race to see who can sediment first.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day sedimented in her mind like heavy rocks.
meanings.sent5: The idea of peace sedimenting in his heart brought a sense of calm.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the dust will be sedimenting on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The debris from the construction site is sedimenting in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The toys in the room seem to be sedimenting into a mountain.
meanings.sent4: The worries were sedimenting in his mind like layers of dust.
meanings.sent5: The snowflakes were sedimenting on the ground, creating a white blanket.

meanings.sent1: The mixture is sedimenting slowly in the container.
meanings.sent2: The particles are sedimenting out of the solution.
meanings.sent3: The thoughts in his mind are sedimenting like settling snowflakes.
meanings.sent4: The emotions were sedimenting in her heart, waiting to be clarified.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting were sedimenting into a beautiful gradient.
